STUDY PLAN OVERVIEW:

This 30-day study plan is designed to help Daniel learn and master Computer Vision concepts within a time frame of 2 hours per day. Given his intermediate level, we will focus on building a strong foundation in the subject by covering key sessions from the course syllabus. Since Daniel's learning style is visual, this plan incorporates practical exercises, diagrams, and illustrations to aid comprehension.

DAY 1:
- Review course syllabus (30 minutes) using the provided 'syllabuscv.pdf' resource
- Focus on Session 2: Introduction to Computer Vision (30 minutes)
- Read relevant sections from 'Computer Vision A Modern Approach - Forsyth , Ponce.pdf' (30 minutes)
- Take notes and create a concept map to visualize key concepts

DAY 2:
- Review and summarize the main ideas from Day 1 (15 minutes)
- Focus on Session 3: Computer Vision Engineering (I) - Illumination (45 minutes)
- Read relevant sections from 'Computer Vision A Modern Approach - Forsyth , Ponce.pdf' (30 minutes)
- Create a diagram illustrating the different types of illumination

DAY 3:
- Review and summarize the main ideas from Days 1-2 (15 minutes)
- Focus on Session 4: Computer Vision Engineering (II) - Cameras (45 minutes)
- Read relevant sections from 'Computer Vision A Modern Approach - Forsyth , Ponce.pdf' (30 minutes)
- Create a table comparing different camera types

DAY 4:
- Review and summarize the main ideas from Days 1-3 (15 minutes)
- Focus on Session 5: Computer Vision Engineering (III) - Wide field of view cameras (45 minutes)
- Read relevant sections from 'Computer Vision A Modern Approach - Forsyth , Ponce.pdf' (30 minutes)
- Create a flowchart illustrating the different camera configurations

... and so on for each day ...

DAY 16:
- Review and summarize the main ideas from Days 1-15 (15 minutes)
- Focus on Session 16: Mid-term exam review (45 minutes)
- Read relevant sections from 'Computer Vision A Modern Approach - Forsyth , Ponce.pdf' (30 minutes)
- Create a practice test to simulate the actual mid-term exam

DAY 17:
- Review and summarize the main ideas from Days 1-16 (15 minutes)
- Focus on Session 17: Pixelwise operations (45 minutes)
- Read relevant sections from 'Computer Vision A Modern Approach - Forsyth , Ponce.pdf' (30 minutes)
- Create a diagram illustrating pixel-wise operations

DAY 18:
- Review and summarize the main ideas from Days 1-17 (15 minutes)
- Focus on Session 18: Local operations (45 minutes)
- Read relevant sections from 'Computer Vision A Modern Approach - Forsyth , Ponce.pdf' (30 minutes)
- Create a table comparing different local operation techniques

DAY 19:
- Review and summarize the main ideas from Days 1-18 (15 minutes)
- Focus on Session 19: Global operations (45 minutes)
- Read relevant sections from 'Computer Vision A Modern Approach - Forsyth , Ponce.pdf' (30 minutes)
- Create a flowchart illustrating global operation techniques

DAY 20:
- Review and summarize the main ideas from Days 1-19 (15 minutes)
- Focus on Session 20: Salient feature detection (45 minutes)
- Read relevant sections from 'Computer Vision A Modern Approach - Forsyth , Ponce.pdf' (30 minutes)
- Create a diagram illustrating different salient feature detection techniques

RECOMMENDED RESOURCES:

* 'Computer Vision A Modern Approach - Forsyth, Ponce.pdf': This book is an excellent resource for building a strong foundation in Computer Vision. It covers the fundamental concepts and provides detailed explanations.
* 'syllabuscv.pdf': This syllabus will serve as a reference point to ensure that we are covering all the necessary topics.

IMPLEMENTATION TIPS:

* Set aside dedicated time each day to study and review material.
* Use visual aids such as diagrams, tables, and flowcharts to help solidify concepts in your mind.
* Practice solving problems and creating illustrations to reinforce understanding.
* Review previous days' material regularly to maintain a strong foundation.
* Take regular breaks to avoid burnout and maintain focus.
